subject: Re: [junit] Problems with JUnit + Ant + TestCase
msgSnippet: ... Does MyTestCase extend TestCase? Does MyTestCase declare any tests? Assuming MyTestCase doesn t actually declare any tests, I recommend making it abstract
messageBody:
Matthew Beermann wrote:

> I'm trying to run a whole suite of JUnits at once using "ant test".
> The problem is that some (but not all) of the test output XML files
> are completely empty. I've seen this problem discussed in this group
> before, but I think my problem is different:
>
> I'm using a class in some places that extends TestCase and does some
> database setup work. The JUnits that extend MyTestCase are the ones
> that don't show up; the ones that extend it directly, do.

Does MyTestCase extend TestCase?
Does MyTestCase declare any tests?

Assuming MyTestCase doesn't actually declare any tests, I recommend
making it abstract so that Ant's test runner doesn't try to extract
tests from it directly and execute them. That could be part of the problem.

This is the point at which you'd need to get more specific for me to be
able to help you, but perhaps some others have other ideas.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
